definitions.definition: A member of the most illustrious of the colleges of priests of the Roman religion, the College of Pontiffs ; a pontifex .
A bishop of the early Church; now specifically, the Pope .
Any chief figure or leader of a religion .

main_definition: ( historical , Ancient Rome ) A member of the most illustrious of the colleges of priests of the Roman religion, the College of Pontiffs ; a pontifex . [from 17th c.]
secondary_definitions: A bishop of the early Church; now specifically, the Pope . [from 16th c.]
( figuratively ) Any chief figure or leader of a religion . [from 16th c.]
